channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report X-2024080370
item.description:
Report X-2024080370

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-13T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-06
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: I was unable to determine the cause of the 2 loose caps the caused the leakage. It appeared to be improper handling. The leakage was contained inside the box but did get on the other 2 bottles as well. So, all 4 bottles were entered as damaged. 2 leaked and the other 2 stained.

item.title: Report X-2024080287
item.description:
Report X-2024080287

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-22
  • City: MIDWAY
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DRIVER PICKED UP THREE PACKAGES OF FIREWORKS. 2 WERE LABELED TNT POPITS TRICK NOISE MAKER, AND 1 WAS LABELED TNT STREAMER CANNON. DRIVER DISCOVERED ON PACKAGE CAR IN THE UNLOAD, AND HELD FOR CUSTOMER PICK UP. THESE PACKAGES ARE NOT DAMAGED BUT ARE UNDECLARED WITH NO HAZARD LABEL, NO UN LABEL, OR SHIPPING PAPERS. THERMAL LABELS HAVE PARTIAL NOVELTY FIREWORKS STATEMENT ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS: 1Z35E5950392364068 AND 1Z35E5950390727992
